hyperlink\">\n            <div class=\"newsandeventsbox\">\n                <div class=\"homepagesectionheader2\">\n                    News and Events\n                </div>\n                <div>\n                    <div style=\"font-size: 16px; font-style: italic; margin-top: 10px;\">\n  <strong>Property Tax Bills Due March 1 Show Local Government Debt, Pappas Says</strong>\n\n</div>\n<div>\n<p>Taxpayers can stay home to make online payment of property tax bills that show them the debt of each local government that levies taxes on their homes and other real property, Cook County Treasurer Maria Pappas said today.</p>\n\n<p>Nearly 1.8 million property tax bills for the First Installment of Tax Year 2016 have been mailed to owners of homes, businesses and land, and the due date for on-time payment is March 1, Pappas said.</p>\n\n<p>“No need to leave the house when you can pay online,” Pappas said.  Simply by logging onto cookcountytreasurer.com, online payment can be made from a smart phone, a laptop, or a computer at work or in a library.</p>\n\n<p>Anywhere from seven to 20 taxing districts – such as local governments and school districts – levy taxes on a given property, Pappas explained, adding that First Installment bills are 55 percent of last year’s total property tax.</p>\n\n<p>On the front of every mailed bill, below the amount owed, is a section called “Taxing District Debt and Financial Data.”  That section lists each taxing district that levies a tax on a property and gives the following financial information about each district:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li>Money Owed by Your Taxing Districts</li>\n<li>Pension and Healthcare Amounts Promised by Your Taxing Districts</li>\n<li>Amount of Pension and Healthcare Shortage</li>\n<li>Percentage of Pension and Healthcare Costs Taxing Districts Can Pay</li>\n</ul>\n\n<p>Those who log onto <a href=\"http://www.cookcountytreasurer.com/\">cookcountytreasurer.com</a> can see even more information by selecting “Want to see your local government debt?” and entering the 14-digit Property Index Number for the property or the name of a taxing district.</p>\n\n</div>\n\n                </div>\n                <div class=\"blacktextbold\" style=\"margin-top: 30px;\">\n                    <a href=\"newsandvideos.aspx\">Search the News and Video Library</a>\n                </div>\n            </div>\n        </div>\n    </div>\n</div>\n\n</div>\n\n<div id=\"TaxDates\">\n    \n<div                   <div class=\"homepagesectionheader2\">\n                                    Tax Due Dates and Bill Schedule\n                                </div>\n                                <p><strong>The due date for the Tax Year 2016 First Installment&nbsp;was Wednesday, March 1, 2017.</strong></p>\n\n<p>In Cook County, the due date for the First Installment property taxes is always the first business day in March.&nbsp; According to Illinois law, the First Installment taxes are 55% of the prior year's total tax (or 55% of the adjusted tax if an assessment certificate of error is certified by the previous November 30).</p>\n\n<p><strong>The tentative due date for the Tax Year 2016 Second Installment is August 1, 2017.<strong></strong></strong></p>\n\n<p>The Second Installment due date may vary. This is because the Second Installment bill relies on the delivery of various sets of data by other state and county agencies. Unlike the First Installment bill, the Second Installment bill reflects the new assessed values, assessment appeals, exemptions, state equalization factor, and taxing-district tax rates.</p>\n\n\n\n\n<p><em>Check back at this site for updates.</em></p>\n\n                            </div>\n                        </td>\n                        <td style=\"background-color: #b7babf; vertical-align: top;\">\n                            <div class=\"taxbillschedule\">\n                                <p><strong>May 22, 2017:</strong><br>\nBloom Township Tax Year 2015 Supplemental Delinquent Tax Sale begins..</p>\n\n<p><strong>July 6, 2017: </strong><br>\nScavenger Tax Sale begins.</p>\n\n<p><strong>August 1, 2017:</strong><br>\nTax Year 2016 Second Installment tax payments due.</p>\n\n<p><strong>December 4, 2017: </strong><br>\n2016 Annual Delinquent Tax Sale begins.</p>\n\n                            </div>\n                        </td>\n                    </tr>\n                </tbody></table>\n            </div>\n            <div class=\"taxdates810\">\n                <div class=\"duedates\">\n                    <div class=\"homepagesectionheader2\">\n                        Due Dates\n                    </div>\n                    <p><strong>The due date for the Tax Year 2016 First Installment&nbsp;was Wednesday, March 1, 2017.</strong></p>\n\n<p>In Cook County, the due date for the First Installment property taxes is always the first business day in March.&nbsp; According to Illinois law, the First Installment taxes are 55% of the prior year's total tax (or 55% of the adjusted tax if an assessment certificate of error is certified by the previous November 30).</p>\n\n<p><strong>The tentative due date for the Tax Year 2016 Second Installment is August 1, 2017.<strong></strong></strong></p>\n\n<p>The Second Installment due date may vary. This is because the Second Installment bill relies on the delivery of various sets of data by other state and county agencies. Unlike the First Installment bill, the Second Installment bill reflects the new assessed values, assessment appeals, exemptions, state equalization factor, and taxing-district tax rates.</p>\n\n\n\n\n<p><em>Check back at this site for updates.</em></p>\n\n                </div>\n                <div class=\"taxbillschedule\">\n                    <div
